background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1. This is an application under Sec. 438 of Cr.P.C. for grant of anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: 2. Informant Pramod Sandbhor lodged report with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station by alleging that on 09.11.2018 at around 9.00 p.m. one red Skoda car came there and from it the applicants came out and started beating the informant with fist and kick blows. It is further alleged that one Tejas Salve took out the knife and assaulted informant on hand. Thereafter, informant made hue and cry therefore, assailants ran away. Thereafter, informant's friends gathered there and took the informant to the hospital and after treatment on the basis of the said report C.R.No. 645/2018 has been registered against the applicants and other co-accused.

argumentSentences.text: Informant Pramod Sandbhor lodged report with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station by alleging that on 09.11.2018 at around 9.00 p.m. one red Skoda car came there and from it the applicants came out and started beating the informant with fist and kick blows.
It is further alleged that one Tejas Salve took out the knife and assaulted informant on hand.
Thereafter, informant made hue and cry therefore, assailants ran away.
Thereafter, informant's friends gathered there and took the informant to the hospital and after treatment on the basis of the said report C.R.No.
645/2018 has been registered against the applicants and other co-accused.

arguments.text: 3. By this application applicant contends that he is totally innocent person. His name is falsely implicated. Applicant is reputed and respectable person in the vicinity of Talegaon Dabhade. He is permanent resident of Talegaon Dabhade. Applicant is the only earning member of his family. He is ready to furnish surety and will abide the conditions imposed by the court. Other accused are released on bail. Thus, applicant prayed for anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: By this application applicant contends that he is totally innocent person.
His name is falsely implicated.
Applicant is reputed and respectable person in the vicinity of Talegaon Dabhade.
He is permanent resident of Talegaon Dabhade.
Applicant is the only earning member of his family.
He is ready to furnish surety and will abide the conditions imposed by the court.
Other accused are released on bail.
Thus, applicant prayed for anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: 4. In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 4 and interalia denied all adverse allegations. It is contended that after commission of said crime accused have committed offence vide C.R.No. 656/18 under Sec. 420, 354, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. and provisions of MCOCA are initiated against the accused and investigation in that respect is in progress. Name of the accused is specifically mentioned in F.I.R. Incriminating material is to be seized including clothes, knife etc. Applicant is a habitual offender. There will danger to the life of complainant, their relatives and witnesses. On these lines prosecution prayed for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 4 and interalia denied all adverse allegations.
It is contended that after commission of said crime accused have committed offence vide C.R.No.
656/18 under Sec. 420, 354, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. and provisions of MCOCA are initiated against the accused and investigation in that respect is in progress.
Name of the accused is specifically mentioned in F.I.R. Incriminating material is to be seized including clothes, knife etc.
Applicant is a habitual offender.
There will danger to the life of complainant, their relatives and witnesses.
On these lines prosecution prayed for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 5. Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicant and Ld.A.P.P. for the State. Perused the papers. There are grounds for believing that information is well founded against the accused. It further appears that there serious allegations against applicant accused that he assaulted informant by means of knife. From registration of the offence he is absconding. As per story of the prosecution during investigation of present crime the accused has committed C.R.No. 656/2018 with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station. In the said crime MCOCA has also added. It further appears that in the present crime the blood sample of the accused, clothes on the person of the accused as well as knife used in the crime are yet to be recovered. No doubt, in the instant case accused No. 1 to 3 were released on anticipatory bail. There were allegations against them that they assaulted informant by mean of fist and kick blows, therefore, ground of parity is not applicable to the present applicant accused. Considering the gravity of the offence as well as during pendency of investigation accused has committed another offence, considering attitude and conduct of the accused and investigation is in progress, he is not entitled for anticipatory bail. Thus, following order.

argumentSentences.text: Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicant and Ld.A.P.P.
for the State.
Perused the papers.
There are grounds for believing that information is well founded against the accused.
It further appears that there serious allegations against applicant accused that he assaulted informant by means of knife.
From registration of the offence he is absconding.
As per story of the prosecution during investigation of present crime the accused has committed C.R.No.
656/2018 with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station.
In the said crime MCOCA has also added.
It further appears that in the present crime the blood sample of the accused, clothes on the person of the accused as well as knife used in the crime are yet to be recovered.
No doubt, in the instant case accused No. 1 to 3 were released on anticipatory bail.
There were allegations against them that they assaulted informant by mean of fist and kick blows, therefore, ground of parity is not applicable to the present applicant accused.

Considering the gravity of the offence as well as during pendency of investigation accused has committed another offence, considering attitude and conduct of the accused and investigation is in progress, he is not entitled for anticipatory bail.
Thus, following order.

order.text: O R D E R 1. Cri.Bail Appln.No. 82/2019 is hereby rejected. 2. Inform the concern police station.

footer: ( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 23.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
processedText:
Bail Appln.No. 82/2019 CNR-MHPU01-000316-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1. This is an application under Sec. 438 of Cr.P.C. for grant of anticipatory bail. 
---background-ends---
2. Informant Pramod Sandbhor lodged report with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station by alleging that on 09.11.2018 at around 9.00 p.m. one red Skoda car came there and from it the applicants came out and started beating the informant with fist and kick blows. It is further alleged that one Tejas Salve took out the knife and assaulted informant on hand. Thereafter, informant made hue and cry therefore, assailants ran away. Thereafter, informant's friends gathered there and took the informant to the hospital and after treatment on the basis of the said report C.R.No. 645/2018 has been registered against the applicants and other co-accused. 
---argument-ends---
3. By this application applicant contends that he is totally innocent person. His name is falsely implicated. Applicant is reputed and respectable person in the vicinity of Talegaon Dabhade. He is permanent resident of Talegaon Dabhade. Applicant is the only earning member of his family. He is ready to furnish surety and will abide the conditions imposed by the court. Other accused are released on bail. Thus, applicant prayed for anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. In response to the show cause notice prosecution has filed its say vide Exh. 4 and interalia denied all adverse allegations. It is contended that after commission of said crime accused have committed offence vide C.R.No. 656/18 under Sec. 420, 354, 323, 504, 506 r/w 34 of I.P.C. and provisions of MCOCA are initiated against the accused and investigation in that respect is in progress. Name of the accused is specifically mentioned in F.I.R. Incriminating material is to be seized including clothes, knife etc. Applicant is a habitual offender. There will danger to the life of complainant, their relatives and witnesses. On these lines prosecution prayed for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
5. Heard Ld.Counsel for the applicant and Ld.A.P.P. for the State. Perused the papers. There are grounds for believing that information is well founded against the accused. It further appears that there serious allegations against applicant accused that he assaulted informant by means of knife. From registration of the offence he is absconding. As per story of the prosecution during investigation of present crime the accused has committed C.R.No. 656/2018 with Talegaon Dabhade Police Station. In the said crime MCOCA has also added. It further appears that in the present crime the blood sample of the accused, clothes on the person of the accused as well as knife used in the crime are yet to be recovered. No doubt, in the instant case accused No. 1 to 3 were released on anticipatory bail. There were allegations against them that they assaulted informant by mean of fist and kick blows, therefore, ground of parity is not applicable to the present applicant accused. Considering the gravity of the offence as well as during pendency of investigation accused has committed another offence, considering attitude and conduct of the accused and investigation is in progress, he is not entitled for anticipatory bail. Thus, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1. Cri.Bail Appln.No. 82/2019 is hereby rejected. 2. Inform the concern police station. 
---order-ends---
( S. H. Gwalani ) Dt. : 23.01.2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune.
